prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: Young girl purporting to be the 2nd Yatagarasu. She's on the trail of her father's killer.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Father of Kay, and admirable prosecutor, he was killed 7 years ago by Calisto Yew
Character 2
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Killed Kay's father 7 years ago. Claimed to be Yatagarasu and then made her escape.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Shih-na
Description: Lang's trusty secretary. Level-headed, she supports him in his investigations.
Character 5
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. Cooperating w/ Interpol on smuggling case.
Character 6
Name: Colias Palaeno
Description: Ambassador of Babahl who will do absolutely everything for his country's tourism industry.
Character 7
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: The victim. Amb. Palaeno's secretary and secretariat. Apparently, was a good man.
Character 8
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: Boasts he has the highest arrest rate in Interpol. He is after the smuggling ring.
Character 9
Name: Quercus Alba
Description: Ambassador of Allebahst. Also retired army man. May explain why overly-harsh on himself.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The man under the Steel Samurai mask. Sadly, he is a friend from grade school.
Character 11
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. His partner was killed 7 yrs. ago. He's here after Calisto Yew.
Character 12
Name: Mask☆DeMasque II
Description: Opportunist unrelated to 1st DeMasque. Found in Allebahst. Real name: Ka-Shi Nou.
Character 13
Name: Ex-Security Lady
Description: The woman behind the Pink Princess mask. I believe her real name is Wendy Oldbag.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Embassy Guide
Description: Two countries share this building with borders.
Evidence 2
Name: Steel Samurai's Autograph
Description: Autograph with a sketch of his face and weapon.
Evidence 3
Name: Notes on Coachen's Body
Description: COD: single stab to base of neck. The body wasn't badly burnt by the fire.
Evidence 4
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: The Yatagarasu stole this from this embassy 7 years ago. It is also a knife.
Evidence 5
Name: Knife → Babahlese Knife → Allebahstian Knife
Description: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound. The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines? Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.
Evidence 6
Name: Babahl's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. It was a fake, but was swapped with the real one. Is originally from Allebahst.
Evidence 7
Name: Cohdopian Paper Document
Description: Accounting doc related to smuggling. Proof someone in 1 of the countries is ringleader. Doc related to smuggling of Babahlese ink. It appears to point to Mr. Coachen.
Evidence 8
Name: Babahlese Knife Handle
Description: Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found.
Evidence 9
Name: Counterfeit Bills
Description: Made with Babahlese ink, they are in circulation in Zheng Fa. It's hard to tell they're fake. Bills circulating in Zheng Fa. Made by Coachen. They were all burned up in Mr. Coachen's office in Babahl.
Evidence 10
Name: Babahlese Ink
Description: Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of some specific reason. Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of its use in counterfeiting.
Evidence 11
Name: DeMasque II's Note
Description: Request for the theft of the Primidux Statue with a map to where the statue is. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Same shape as notepad in Babahl office. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Handwriting matches that of Manny Coachen.
Evidence 12
Name: Samurai Sword
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Is thought to be what killed DeMasque II.
Evidence 13
Name: Photo with Steel Samurai
Description: Taken in front of Allebahst's Statue before murder.
Evidence 14
Name: Passionflowers
Description: Two large flowers in bloom. The vines are supported by stakes and are still growing. Two large flowers in bloom. Ambassador Alba takes great care in growing them.
Evidence 15
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Larry hit it against a wall and bent it. It's hollow. Because he bent it, Larry couldn't do the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack.
Evidence 16
Name: Allebahst's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder. Bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office. Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon.
Evidence 17
Name: Stand-In Request
Description: Request for Ms. Oldbag to stand in for Mindy, the Pink Princess actress who fell ill.
Evidence 18
Name: Letter from a Stalker
Description: For Ms. Oldbag. Has mistakes from bad penmanship.
Evidence 19
Name: Lady's Undershirt
Description: Found in office fireplace. There's only 1 person here who would own such a shirt. Found in office fireplace. Ms. Oldbag was drying it in the fireplace next door.
Evidence 20
Name: Samurai Dogs
Description: Present for embassy staff. Ms. Oldbag took and ate a few from the dressing room.
Evidence 21
Name: Silhouette Lantern
Description: Runs on whitcrystal oil, which burns green. It's a Babahlese souvenir.
Evidence 22
Name: Pick
Description: Found at the Open-Air Stage, it looks like a guitar pick. It's also wet for some reason.
Evidence 23
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.
Evidence 24
Name: Fountain Spouts
Description: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.
Evidence 25
Name: Photo of Yatagarasu
Description: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire. Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.
Evidence 26
Name: Fires in Babahl
Description: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.
Evidence 27
Name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
Description: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.
Evidence 28
Name: Wire
Description: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock in Mr. Coachen's office.
Evidence 29
Name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
Description: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used. Yatagarasu escaped through the revolving fireplace wall and into the next room over.
Evidence 30
Name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.
Evidence 31
Name: Trump Card
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.
Evidence 32
Name: Video Tape
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen. Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.
Evidence 33
Name: Counterfeit Plate
Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: During the first Babahlese fire, I assisted in putting out the fire.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 1
Testimony: During the second fire, I was searching for the Yatagarasu that had appeared in Babahl.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 2
Testimony: While I was searching, I heard a scream coming from the next room over.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 3
Testimony: Although I was in the next room, I was unable to catch a glimpse of the Yatagarasu.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 4
Testimony: To be honest, I'm actually very skeptical that the girl's "Yatagarasu" even exists.
Person: Shih-na

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let me try to work through this problem step by step. The user has provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. 

First, I'll start by reviewing the testimonies and the relevant evidence entries to see if any discrepancies pop up.

Looking at the testimonies from Shih-na (Testimony 0-4):

Testimony 0: Shih-na says she was assisting in putting out the first Babahlese fire.  
Testimony 1: During the second fire, she was searching for the Yatagarasu in Babahl.  
Testimony 2: She heard a scream from the next room while searching.  
Testimony 3: She was in the next room but couldn't see the Yatagarasu.  
Testimony 4: She's skeptical about the girl's claim to be Yatagarasu.  

Now, looking at the evidence related to fires and the Yatagarasu. Evidence 25 is a photo of Yatagarasu taken during the fire, and Evidence 29 mentions the revolving fireplace wall used by Yatagarasu to escape. 

Evidence 25 says the photo was taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors. Testimony 0 mentions the first fire, and Testimony 1 refers to a second fire. 

Wait, the key point here is Testimony 3 where Shih-na says she was in the next room but couldn't see the Yatagarasu. However, Evidence 29 states that Yatagarasu escaped through the revolving fireplace wall into the next room. If Shih-na was in that next room, she should have seen the Yatagarasu entering, but she claims she couldn't catch a glimpse. That seems contradictory because the evidence suggests Yatagarasu was there, but her testimony says she didn't see them despite being present.

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 29: "Yatagarasu escaped through the revolving fireplace wall and into the next room over." So if Shih-na was in that next room (as per Testimony 3), then the Yatagarasu would have entered that room, but she didn't see them. That's a contradiction because the evidence implies Yatagarasu was there, but her testimony says she didn't see them even though she was in the same area.

Another angle: Evidence 26 mentions two fires in Babahl. Testimony 0 and 1 talk about first and second fires. If the evidence about the photo (Evidence 25) was taken after the first fire, and Shih-na was involved in putting out the first fire (Testimony 0), but the photo shows Yatagarasu during the fire, maybe she should have seen them then. But she didn't, leading to contradiction.

Wait, Testimony 3 says during the second fire she was in the next room when the scream happened, but didn't see Yatagarasu. Evidence 29 says Yatagarasu escaped into that next room via the fireplace wall. So if the escape happened when she was there, but she didn't see it, that's a contradiction between Testimony 3 and Evidence 29.

So the conflicting pair would be Evidence 29 and Testimony 3. Therefore, the answer should be {"evidence": 29, "testimony": 3}.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. My task is to identify one pair where an evidence and a testimony contradict each other.

First, I'll go through each testimony and see if any evidence directly contradicts it. Let's start with the testimonies from Shih-na:

Testimony 0: "In my eyes, all you've proved is that the rotating fireplace wall was used... but you can't really call that proof that the Yatagarasu used the fireplace, now can you?"  
Testimony 1: "...but you can't really call that proof that the Yatagarasu used the fireplace, now can you?"  
Testimony 2: "So then, who was it that used the rotating wall? Show me your answer with real evidence."  
Testimony 3: "Remember, we've already finished our very thorough investigation... and we found not a single suspicious thing in Mr. Coachen's office."  
Testimony 4: "...and we found not a single suspicious thing in Mr. Coachen's office."

Looking at the testimonies, Testimony 3 and 4 mention that there was a thorough investigation and nothing suspicious was found in Coachen's office. Now, I need to check the evidences to see if any contradict this.

Looking at Evidence 28: "Wire: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock in Mr. Coachen's office."  
This evidence indicates that there was a wire found in Coachen's office, which is part of Babahl's area. If the wire was found there, that's a suspicious item. Shih-na's testimony (Testimony 4) claims that nothing suspicious was found there. This directly contradicts because the wire is a suspicious item found in Coachen's office.

Another evidence to check is Evidence 29: "Revolving Fireplace Wall: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used. Yatagarasu escaped through the revolving fireplace wall and into the next room over."  
However, Shih-na's Testimony 0 and 1 question if the fireplace's use proves Yatagarasu's involvement. But the contradiction here is more about the wire in the office versus the testimony saying nothing was found.

So, the key contradiction is between Evidence 28 (wire found in Coachen's office) and Testimony 4 (claims no suspicious items found there). Therefore, the correct pair should be Evidence 28 and Testimony 4.
</think>
